TableColumnsTooltips.EventDate: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.HistoryEventDate: Date and time of the history event.
TableColumnsTooltips.DCS:
Data Coding Scheme. Possible values are:
  • 0: SMSC Default Alphabet,
  • 1: IA5 (CCITT T.50)/ASCII (ANSI X3.4),
  • 2: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1),
  • 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 5: JIS (X 0208-1990),
  • 6: Cyrllic (ISO-8859-5),
  • 7: Latin/Hebrew (ISO-8859-8),
  • 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646),
  • 9: Pictogram Encoding,
  • 10: ISO-2022-JP (Music Codes),
  • 11: Reserved,
  • 12: Reserved,
  • 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990),
  • 14: KS C 5601,
  • 15: Reserved.
TableColumnsTooltips.Reason: Error Code. 0 if Trx Result is Success and appropriate error code otherwise. Error Code shall be interpreted within specified Error Context. Same Error Code value may have different meanings in different contexts.

TableColumnsTooltips.Date: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.OrigTypeOfNumber:
Sender (Originator) Type of Number.
  • 0: Unknown
  • 1: International
  • 2: National
  • 3: Network Specific
  • 4: Subscriber Number
  • 5: Alphanumeric
  • 6: Abbreviated
TableColumnsTooltips.TrafficType:
Type of the traffic.
  • 11: MO
  • 12: MO Inbound
  • 13: MO Outbound
  • 21: MT
  • 22: MT Alphanumeric
  • 23: MT Shortcode
  • 24: MT Intl to Inbound
  • 31: SRI
TableColumnsTooltips.OPResult:
Result of the operation.
  • 0: No Error
  • 1: Error
TableColumnsTooltips.OPErrorCode: Error code of operation (MAP Error Code).
TableColumnsTooltips.OPRejectMethod:
Reject Method.
  • 1: Silent Discard
  • 2: Reject with Error
TableColumnsTooltips.ConcatInfo: Concat SMS part no, 1 <= part no <= total part count / Concat SMS total part count [Concat SMS correlator is used correlate parts of a concatenated SMS, value is same for all parts]

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrRedirectionNum: Redirecting Party MSISDN who forwarded incoming calls to the Service (Called Party is same with the Redirecting Party for normal / not forwarded calls).
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrOriginatingAddressPresentation:
Calling Line Identification Restriction (CLIR) Status. Possible values are:
  • Normal: Not Restricted
  • Private: Restricted
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrRedirectionReason:
Reason for redirection to the Service. Possible reasons are:
  • Unreachable: Called Party is not reachable, phone switched-off, out-of-coverage.
  • Busy: Called Party is busy.
  • Not Answered: Called Party did not answer the call.
  • Unconditional: Called Party unconditionally forwarded all calls to the Service.
  • Undefined: Reason undefined or not specified.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrSMSTicket: Ticket received from SMSC for the submitted SMS. Used to correlate submitted MT SMS and its Delivery Report.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrSMStatus:
Final delivery status of the Missed Call Notification SMS. Possible delivery status values are:
  • 100: DELIVERED
  • 200: WILL_BE_RETRIED
  • 300: FAILED
  • 600: ENROUTE
  • 700: EXPIRED
  • 500: DELETED
  • 400: UNKNOWN

XsmOffer.NotifySubscriberOnStateChanges: Notify Subscriber About Subscription State Changes

Tooltips.Name: Offer\'s internal unique name.
Tooltips.State: Offer\'s state. An Offer is subscribe-able if its state is ACTIVE. New Subscriptions is not allowed, and existing subscriptions are terminated during renewal if the Offer\'s state is INACTIVE.
Tooltips.PriceGroup: Offer\'s Price Group. Not only to calculate the Offer\'s price for the customer, it\'s also used for customer\'s Offer eligibility check.
Tooltips.Category: Offer\'s category(ies). Max. 10 categories can be assigned to an Offer. Categories are not pre-defined, arbitrary category labels can be added.
Tooltips.OfferTitles: Offer\'s customer-friendly name in different languages. Used for preferred language display at subscription and self-care channels, Mobile Application, WEB, etc.
Tooltips.ChargingPeriod: Offer\'s renewal period. Offer is renewed/charged at specified periods.
Tooltips.SubscriptionDuration: Number of renewals before subscription is terminated. e.g. in a monthly subscription if Subscription Renewal Count is set to 12, then subscription will be renewed 12 times and then terminated Meaning that; subscription will last 12 months. Subscription Renewal Count with value 0 means there is no renewal count limit.
Tooltips.LastSubscriptionDate: Offer\'s last subscription date. Offer is not subscribe-able after this date and new subscription requests are rejected. It has nothing to do with existing subscriptions. Applies to both normal and trial Offers.
Tooltips.NotifySubscriberOnStateChanges: Policy to whether notify or be silent during subscription state changes. e.g. when offer subscription is suspended due to Insufficient Credit or re-activated after successful charging during retries.
Tooltips.RenewalPolicy:
Policy to whether notify or be silent during subscription renewals.
NO RENEWAL: Subscription is never renewed,
AUTO: Subscription is automatically renewed, but customer is not notified about the renewal,
AUTO WIITH NOTIFICATION: Subscription is automatically renewed, and customer is notified after and about the renewal.
